Question 57) Many species of woody plants are found in the Brazilian cerrado. For survival under long periods of dry and periodic drought and burning, proper to this ecosystem, these plants have developed very peculiar structures.
The most appropriate adaptive structures for the survival of this group of plants under the environmental conditions of that ecosystem are:
A) Thin and without grooves or cracks.
B) Strait and rectilinear stems.
C) narrow and membranous leaves.
D) apical gems with dense peak.
E) Superficial roots, in general, aerial.
